content: Chinese fried snack ***Ham chim peng*** ([traditional Chinese](/wiki/Traditional_Chinese_characters): 鹹煎餅; [simplified Chinese](/wiki/Simplified_Chinese_characters): 咸煎饼; [pinyin](/wiki/Pinyin): *xiánjiānbǐng*; [Jyutping](/wiki/Jyutping): *haam4 zin1 beng2*; lit. 'salty fried pancake'), also known in Singapore and Malaysia as ***haam ji peng***, ***hum ji peng***, among other variations, is a fried [Cantonese pastry](/wiki/Cantonese_cuisine) popular through Southeast Asia. Commonly eaten as a breakfast food, it is sometimes fried with a coating of sesame seeds. There are at least 3 varieties of ham chin peng - with glutinous rice, five spice powder and [red bean paste](/wiki/Red_bean_paste). The pastry is eaten throughout [Southeast Asia](/wiki/Southeast_Asia), where it is known as [Indonesian](/wiki/Indonesian_language): *kue bantal*, and [Vietnamese](/wiki/Vietnamese_language): *bánh tiêu*, among others. - Food portal - China portal - Singapore portal - [List of doughnut varieties](/wiki/List_of_doughnut_varieties) - [List of fried dough varieties](/wiki/List_of_fried_dough_varieties) - [Beignet](/wiki/Beignet) ### Other Chinese fried dough dishes - [Ox-tongue pastry](/wiki/Ox-tongue_pastry) - [Shuangbaotai](/wiki/Shuangbaotai) - [Youtiao](/wiki/Youtiao) This article related to [Chinese cuisine](/wiki/Chinese_cuisine) is a stub. title: Ham chim peng
